body.p: To his Excellency, Beriah Magoffin Governor of The Commonwealth of Kentucky.

We, the undersigned, citizens of Caldwell County Kentucky, have long known Thomas. B. Wadlington & he has ever been considered, a good and true hearted Citizen, Known & noted for his industry and his orderly conduct. The difficulty in which he was engaged with Milton A. Cartwright, did not appear to us, to be of his seeking, nor are we satisfied that the case was presented to the Jury as it really occurred. We hope your Excellency will review the case & give the poor man the benefit of every doubt or ^and we^ desire, that his case may be judged of in mercy, & regarded with favor, & that your Excellency will take into consideration every circumstance that ought to operate in his behalf. And we desire that your Excellency may & will be persuaded that it is consistent with your duty to extend to him executive clemency, & that his life may be spared. either by a full pardon or by a commutation of his punishment -- Yours respectfully,
Jan'y 21 1861.

S,, W,, Towry
E,, S,, Cannan

Sworn to before me by H. C. Davis Jany 29th 1861.
